column25:
1. Basic Computer Literacy 
Operating systems: Familiarity with Windows, macOS, or Linux. 
File management: Organizing, saving, and finding files using folders and directories. 
Keyboard shortcuts: Using shortcuts for efficiency (e.g., Ctrl+C for copy, Ctrl+V for paste). 
2. Word Processing 
Proficiency in Microsoft Word, Google Docs, or similar programs for creating, editing, and formatting documents. 
Ability to use features like tables, headers/footers, and text formatting tools. 
3. Spreadsheets 
Understanding of Microsoft Excel or Google Sheets for data entry, creating formulas, generating charts, and analyzing data. 
Knowledge of basic functions like SUM, AVERAGE, VLOOKUP, and PivotTables. 
4. Email and Communication Tools 
Using email clients (Outlook, Gmail) for effective communication and file sharing. 
Familiarity with scheduling tools like Google Calendar, Microsoft Outlook, or Zoom for meetings. 
5. Internet Skills 
Navigating web browsers (Chrome, Firefox, Safari) and performing searches using search engines. 
Knowledge of online safety practices, including recognizing phishing scams and using strong passwords. 
6. Presentation Software 
Creating presentations with Microsoft PowerPoint, Google Slides, or similar tools. 
Understanding of visual design principles for clear, engaging presentations (e.g., using appropriate fonts, colors, and layouts). 
7. Social Media and Collaboration Tools 
Basic knowledge of platforms like LinkedIn, Facebook, Twitter, or Instagram. 
Familiarity with collaboration tools like Slack, Trello, or Asana for team projects and communication. 
8. Basic Troubleshooting and Maintenance 
Ability to solve simple technical problems like software errors, slow performance, and network issues. 
Knowledge of antivirus software and how to maintain system security. 
9. Cloud Storage and File Sharing 
Familiarity with cloud storage platforms like Google Drive, Dropbox, or OneDrive for storing, sharing, and collaborating on files.

I would say that the decision to undertake Sadhnapada is deeply personal one and it has stem from a genuine longing to delve deeper into my own existence . I wish to go through sadhnapada at this perticular time as I feel a strong pull towards selfie transformation. I have reached a point in my life where I am questioning the nature of my own existence ,my purpose and the true meaning of happiness and fulfilment . I seek a deeper connection with the world around , beyond the superficialities of life .  
 
Through Sadhanapada I hope to grow in several ways .  
1. Cultivate a deeper sense of inner peace and clarity .  
2. To enhance my physical and mental well being .  
3 . To Exprience oneness with universe through practice of yoga and meditation .  
4. To establish my self in Sadhna  
5. To live life consciously with awareness and joy .

column54: I have cleared my loans, and confident of managing family expenses for 10 months. I want to relook at life and career with a fresh perspective. I want to be able to live everyday with a sense of liveliness and zeal. Need clarity in terms of the direction I should take going forward.
column55: I have experienced the strict daily schedule, with little personal time for limited periods during my academics and work, but doing this for an extended period of 8 months will require openness during the initial month for getting accustomed. No days off is a first for me, this will definitely force me to live every moment since there's no separate time for that. I feel the requirements, expectations and guidelines are fair and can be adhered to strictly. Wishing that the regular sadhana will help me cope up with the changes and I can start preparing for the same. I have also experienced similar schedules when volunteering at Sadhguru Sannidhi although that is for a short period.
column56: I have lived in large campuses during my academics where it was required to walk kms just to get to one class then to the other following a fixed shedule. That requires planning time efficiently and managing expectations with stakeholders. I have been practicing sitting cross-legged for 20 min sukh kriyas thrice a day, eating by sitting down for Samyama for less than a month now, hope I can increase the kriya time. I have volunteered for shifting saplings in the nursery at Sannidhi for an entire day, the farming activity can be physically demanding, which needs getting used to.
column57: I like physically intense work, feels tiring and good by the end of the day. I am already used to office based work for 5-6 days in a week. The challenge for me will be working on the same task without breaks or weekend offs, but I should be able to adjust to that over time. If there's facility to switch tasks for some periods that might be helpful.
column58: I have stayed in shared rooms and hostels for more than 5 years. That should not be a problem for me. I have experienced dormitory stays in the ashram before I found that quite hygienic.
column59: I stay with my Mom, wife and daughter and have spoken to my Mom and my wife about this. My Mom is encouraging me. I have to keep in touch with my 4 yr old daughter, even if for 5 mins a day, so she does not miss me so much.

column54: First of all, I thought of participating in this program after completing my college but I got placed in a company and then I thought of getting work experience for at least 2 years, but I constantly kept thinking of what do I do next in my life. So, I chose this path to first get a clarity on life and on how I should feel, think, talk, respond, and be with myself, so that when I be with others or in the world outside I am a much more better person.
column55:
1. Daily Schedule - In my life, whenever I was in college hostel or stayed alone, I used to follow a schedule like waking up early, doing my practices and then going to college or work. But whenever I was at home for holidays or any other day, I am not regular in waking up early and following a schedule as I feel more relaxed there. So, I think whenever I am left alone I will give my 100 percent to follow the schedule. 
 
2. Personal Time - One thing about me, I have very few friends to whom I talk rarely. The one person to whom I share everything is my mother but I wanted to know how it would be or how will I decide if I am left alone. So I find this as an opportunity to make me rely on myself for everything that I do and think. 
 
3. No Days Off - I am working in an IT company and I always waited for the weekend but whenever weekend arrives, I simply do household chores, in my free time scroll through reels, eat, sleep and not do anything productive. Instead of spending weekends like this, I feel it would be great if it would go productive. Even though, I tell this I know that it might be difficult for me to accept this but as days go by I think I will be able to adapt to it and will even forget what day it is while being in the ashram.
column56:
1. Walking long distances - In my work, I go to office only twice a week as it is hybrid, that to in two wheeler. So I don't walk that frequently. But when I initially joined the company and was in a hostel. I used to walk a total of 4 kms in a total to go to the office and come to the hostel daily. Also during college days I used to walk 4 times from college to hostel in the morning and for lunch and in the evening. So, even though now I don't walk much, I am used to walking and I think I'll be able to do it subsequently. 
 
2. Sitting cross legged - Whenever I work from home, I sit on the floor and work. But still I'll practice sitting cross legged and in arthasidhasana for more time before I come to this program. 
 
3. Difficult Activities - I am not a person to usually do physical activities and heavy lifting, but if that is the seva I am assigned to I'll go through it and train my body to break that limitation as well.
column57: I am willing to do the activity assigned to me. One thing about me I have not done physically intense jobs before like shifting heavy objects, working in the fields for long time and it would be difficult for me to do it initially. But as days go by I think I'll be able to adapt to that.
column58: During my college days, I shared my room with 3 other roommates, so a total of 4. And also from the webinar I got to know that we come to the stay area only to sleep, so I think it will be fine for me to be in a dormitory stay area with a four sharing room and share bathroom facilities. I've got a experience in volunteering as I've volunteered in my local centre and also at the Ashram, so it would be fine for me to mingle with people and do things during volunteering activities.

column54:
- Sadhanapada is a must-do in my life, I have failed twice and succeeded last year yet couldn't go because of visa difficulties, each failure was a big blow, however, each time my desire to go has grown much stronger and stronger 
- I have volunteered in Linga Bhairavi Temple in Nepal last year and this year in Isha Institute of Inner-sciences in Tennessee, my body knows the significance of consecrated spaces, and feels their absence after coming back, IYC is a must-go, numerous times I have imaged myself near the presence of Dhyanalinga, I must be there 
- Timewise speaking Sadhanapada is also beautifully designed by Sadhguru, July to Mahashivratri is most beneficial for spiritual growth, besides solar flares are dancing with us these years, it couldn’t be better 
- I also wish to do Samyama in IYC 
- Sadhanas in the Abode of III felt like a breeze, but a little bit of struggle after coming back, this is the importance of good ambience for spiritual growth, I wish to strengthen my sadhanas during Sadhanapada, and learn more sadhanas if I have the chance 
- I am facing career change, fear and doubt make me hesitate to move forward, by Sadhanapada I wish to transform myself to be more joyful & disciplined & unwavering no matter what I do 
- I’ve learned that Seva & Sadhana is great combination to demolish one’s ego/karma and to be more available to grace, this is what Sadhanapada is about, it’s similar to my volunteering experience in Nepal & US but so much more intense & disciplined, and it’s exactly what I want
column55:
- as Shoonya Intensive & BSP alumni I have totally experienced isha’s way of conducting programs——fully scheduled, cut out from the outside world and fully dedicated to one’s inner growth, I understand it, endorse it, and would totally go by it 
- In BSP I was amazed by how beautifully and intelligently the program was designed——it was so conversational, it’s like Sadhguru knew what I gonna think and feel and had already prepared the next step for me, he was not there but he was totally present, Sadhanapada must be the same, beautifully designed by Sadhguru, I would totally embrace his grace without saying a word 
- again I know why Sadhanapada is designed like this and it’s totally what I what——I’d love Sadhguru pushing me towards higher possibilities
column56:
- I have just come back from 6 month volunteering in III Tennessee, did every possible seva, lots of them involves heaving lifting like gardening, warehouse, housekeeping etc., and I love them, great to stretch the body in nature, food felt so much more delicious 
- interesting fact, first two month in III my Apple Watch constantly congratulated me “you have walked longer distance!” “you have climbed more stares!” “your resting heart rate is lower than before!” , after coming back it’s constantly lamenting “your walking distance has been lower” “your total working out time has been declining”… hahaha wish to go back volunteering!!! 
- sounds like bragging again, in III other volunteers was amazed why I was always running instead of walking among locations, while, I want to save time and I love running! can’t wait to run in IYC where the whole land is consecrated 
- about sitting cross legged, after getting addicted to Sadhguru I have given away my expensive ergonomic chair and sit cross legged on the ground ever since, it’s much more scientific and comfortable way to be
column57:
- totally willing to do whatever assigned, at the Bhairavi Temple in Nepal I did everything except selling and in III did every seva except administration, no matter it’s physically intense or office based, I would do whatever needed 
- doing whatever needed is both good for myself and the ashram, good for the ashram, while ashram have lots of work to be done especially IYC takes so many social responsibilities, good for myself because by demolishing likes & dislikes, sevas could loosen our karma/ego structure and make us more available to grace
column58:
- like India, China is crowded, we have grown up in dormitory culture 
- in III Tennessee I shared the room with 6 others, very natural for me
column59:
- in the beginning they were not supportive “you are thirty something now and why are you still doing this nonsense!? you should earn more money, get married and have a son to pass down our family name!!!” 
- when I was in Nepal they were afraid of me becoming a monk…  
- gradually they see how happier and more vibrant I am after coming back from Nepal and US, now they have changed the attitude “do whatever you and to do for one more year and then get married OK?” hahaha

He has done bhavsapdana volunteering and he has done volunteering in sadhguru sannidhi Bengeluru.
Applicant is able to do all his sadhana except angamardana regularly except when he is travelling. He doea Yogasana and surya kriya alternatively. He has done shambhavi mandala twice. He explained the steps of shambhavi mahamudra kriya accurately.

He will be coming to Asharam this year for Adiyogi arpanam and he is planning to stay till December. 
He had questions regarding LTV and pooornaga that SP will give him preference or not ? and also if for some reason (decided work for 2 more years) could not come for program will it affect his application next year ? did not see any concern and is very commited. Hence interview opinion - selected.

There are no loans. But his family is constructing a house and they received half of income than expected from farming. Although his family is independent and can manage it but he thinking if he works for 2 years and expand his saving then his family won't struggle with anything. He already has saving and his family can manage but little more saving would make their concerns disappear. He definitely wants to come for full time in Ashram but this year or may be after 2 year he is confused about that.

He wakes up at 04:00 In the morning and then does his sadhana surya kriya/ yogasana alternative day then shakti chalana and shambhavi then samyama breath watching (sometimes before starting sadhana). He has 2 meals luch at 12 and dinner at 08:30 and goes to sleep at 10:30. When he was working he used to go to office from 08:30 AM to 06:30 PM.  Recently he was gone to US for 40 days and now working on constructing new home in his hometown (legal formalities, hiring of contractor etc.)

column25: Understand computer fundamentals very well, have done courses and operating MS office  programs and utility softwares regularly in my CA(Chartered Accountancy), Familier with popular accounting, auditing and tax filing software.
column36: Applicants major reason for coming to SP is to live under a Guru's guidance for a long period of time. He is having great experiences with shambavi, but wants to do al the advanced programs and SP will be the best time to attend the program, focus on the sadhana and be part of volunteering with a focus on proper schedule and food. He has a hectic work schedule and works almost everyday and will never have the time to do more programs or volunteering otherwise. Applicant, his father and his younger is managing two businesses together as a family. His father is 61 and he feels he might retire next year where it will be impossible for him to leave his business and come for 8 months. So he feels "now" is the best time for him to come.
column54:
I wanted to initiate and fulfill my spiritual needs with full involvement and devotion since after completion of 2019 free inner-engineering program offered during Diwali (I have completed inner-engineering again recently in march 2024.) I wanted to initiate my spiritual journey under Guru's presence who will initiate me to become a full time spiritual seeker but I was tangled up in work and family situations, currently I am 31 years old, eldest in three siblings in the family of five. Due to some legal business dispute which took too long to get resolved I was giving my full attention day and night to my work and family and being an introvert i am struggling to get directions from anywhere in regards with spirituality. Though the nearest Isha yoga center from my town which is Chhatarpur, Delhi is not too far it's around two and half hour travel (one way) on my scooter or car (traffic included), i am not able manage to go there or join any programs there even once though I had plans. And now as court matters have been resolved to the level which is manageable and business is running smoothly I will surely be able to visit Chhatarpur (Delhi) center in coming days and seek necessary guidance but being always in presence of guru during Sadhanapada will definitely accelerate things. 
Why this particular time I wanted to join Sadhanapada? It's more like now and never kind of a situation for me, As we are three of us (me, my father and my younger brother) handling our joint business which are segregated in two segments hence needing at least two members all the time to keep things going. As my father is aging (he is 61 currently) he might retire soon in coming years so i want to initiate my spiritual journey before he decides to retire. And after Sadhanapada i will continue my spiritual journey at home in full throttle with continuing supporting my immediate family. I will retire from my business as time will come on the path to become a full time sadhak/monk. (My ultimate goal is to attain moksha, atleast i want to give it my best).
column55:
For a beginner like me who is initiating a spiritual journey it’s necessary to strictly follow the rules provided by guru to keep itself available to guru at all levels all the time. 
In my understanding these rules and discipline will support my presence (attentiveness).
column56: Due to my daily routine work which is already physically demanding for the average person. I am physically active and fit. I also practice Shambhavi Mahamudra daily which helped me shed 8 kilos and made me fittest ever. Yes, I can walk a long distance 5-6 kms barefoot daily on the ground. I sit in Ardhasiddhasana all the time and don't find any difficulty. I have never done farming, Gardening is my subject of interest. I maintain a few plants on the rooftop. I understand it is a different thing altogether. I think I might be capable of farming as well. It's a matter of opportunity for me if i get it i can do it. Considering the risk of snake bites in fields I can do it with guidance.
column57: I will be happiest to be volunteering in the ashram, I have gone through long office hours happily (3-4 years) and intense physical work is my daily business. I have a trading and manufacturing business of metal hardwares, in this industry intense physical work is a regular thing. If i don't get much physical work i consider that day is not my happiest day, rest all are my happiest days. haha.
column58: I lived in a hostel for about four years (2010-14), I don't find any struggle in sharing space. The good part is if there are many, they have to follow all rules of space, democracy wins.
column59:
My Mother will be saddest, i have a good connection with her though she understands my need she will be fine. My sister doesn't care, she must be happy as long as I am not at home(As I tease her all the time). My brother is fine and will respect my decision and he is more than capable of handling our family business. I already told my dad that I will be going to Sadhguru's ashram in July 2025 and the final decision will be taken by my teachers. My father called my decision stupid and told me that you are independent to take care of your needs. (Deep inside he just wants me to be happy) Also I think My family is ok in my absence as I solo travel every monsoon on mountains for 1-2 weeks, they don't get worried about me. I handle situations quite well. 
In conclusion: I am independent of taking this decision, my family is supportive and will be fine in my absence.

column36: He mentioned his father and brother will be able to take care of the business while he is off as all 3 manage the business together anyways.

He already has experience living in shared spaces when he was preparing for his CA and can easily adjust with simple amenities. He is having only 2 meals a day and eats only sattvic food since his IE.  Wakes up around 6-7 am and goes to bed 9-10 pm usually. (If its festival season he's busy in his shop and goes to bed only at 11). He is used to intense physical work (loading and unloading 600 quintals of material) for his business when his employees are not around. He is touched by sadhguru and want to contribute through seva in any way possible.

He is a partner in two family businesses - retail business of kitchen utensils and other is his family business of hookah pot manufacturing. He deals with customers on day to day basis taking bulk orders and is good with people. He was trying to crack CA for 2-2.5 years years after his B Com. But did not end up finishing the finals and decided to run his family business. Hes been part of his family business since 2016.

Languages known

Hindi & English : Read, Write, Speak, Understand
Punjabi : Speak and Understand
He did B.Com in Open University (part of Delhi University) and graduated in 2013.

His dad is 61 and his mom is 56.  Both are physically healthy and are independent. He has a sister who is 28 years old who lives with them. she is unmarried and not working. He is yet to have a detailed discussion about SP with his dad. His dad is not into spirituality but looks out for him and wants the best for him. It seems he is not able to understand why one has to leave home for 8 months for sadhana . He mentioned he will talk to his dad and we can call his father in a week or two.
He mentioned he has a enough money available as he manages two business (mentioned he can comfortably get many cars now) and should be easily able to manage any expenses during SP.

He was supporting his father with a  legal case regarding his business filed by his father against a bank. He mentioned the case is already settled and signed a month ago and he will never have to step out or manage the case when hes here in SP.

He is regular with his Shambavi since initiation and finished his mandala after as well. There are some minor practice corrections needed for him (Sukha kriya he is not starting and ending it correctly). He agreed to reach out to Ishanga and also attend a sathsang to get it corrected. 

 He mentioned he did not do Shambavi for a month after mandala as he lost 8 kgs and was worried. But he continued to do after as he realized it might be due to his poor eating habits and started switching to a satvic lifestyle. 


Volunteering : He has not done any Isha Volunteering as after in IE in March he has been busy with his business or helping his father with the legal case. He mentioned he will surely come to IYC and volunteer now as he has time now. 

He has other volunteering experiences outside Isha.

1. He has been serving food at his Gurudwara regularly  for all Purnimas for many years (he thinks it should atleast be 15 years)

2. He also volunteers with supporting the Smashan Ghat (cremation ground) near his place. There is a lot of wood needed at a very short time and he always helps out with that (carrying it from different locations) as he sees this as seva.

Applicant is very enthusiastic and mentioned multiple times he wants to live under a Gurus guidance. He is touched by Sadhguru after shambavi and since SP is part of Sadhguru Gurukulam he wants to be part of it.

He doesn't have any loans under his name. But his business (his dad, him and his brother together) have some loans , But he mentioned that is just his working capital (and that is not anything new as that's how they operate). He mentioned that will not be any concern as that's a very small amount for the profits they make.

Physical Ailments : He has asthma when he was a child but no concerns after.

1. He mentioned about a scooter accident 3 years ago where he had a tendon or ligament tear (hes not sure which) on his shoulder. He had a sling for a month but continued to work in his shop. Never got hospitalized. He doesn't have any pain or issue reg this now and doesnt take any medication, follow up.

2. He got affected by Covid. He lost taste completely for 15 days. Seems he did not take any Covid vaccinations as he wanted his body to develop immunity. He agreed to follow health, immunization protocols as prescribed during his stay for SP though.

Mental Ailments : No Concerns

Intoxicants :  He mentioned he stared consuming alcohol 2 years ago. But it was just again whenever he met with his friends (missed to ask the frequency). However stopped it after IE. He mentioned his reason for stopping alcohol was that he was not having good sleep, feeling drowsy and ended up missing sadhana once. He did not want that as he really liked his shambavi. So he never took alcohol after.

Practices : He is regular with his Shambavi since initiation and finished his mandala after as well. There are some minor practice corrections needed for him (Sukha kriya he is not starting and ending it correctly). He agreed to reach out to Ishanga and also attend a satsang to get it corrected. 

He mentioned he did not do Shambavi for a month after mandala as he lost 8 kgs that got him worried. But he continued to do after as he realized it might be due to his poor eating habits and started switching to a satvic lifestyle since then.

Lifestyle : He is pretty active throughout the day at his shop. He is used to intense physical work (loading and unloading 600 quintals of material) for his business with his employees are not around. Already has only 2 meals a day. Wakes up around 6-7 am and goes to bed 9-10 pm usually. (If its festival season hes busy in his shop and goes to bed only at 11)

column36: Anna quit his job as an accountant a year ago and came to India back from Dubai and started working on his ancestral farm after his father passed away. Earlier he had more responsibilities on the farm with few/no labours. Currently, his family built a building for the labours to stay and got enough labours to manage the farm so that he can spend dedicated seven months in the ashram. His mom is going to manage all the labours for farming.

Anna visited IYC 15 to 16 times till now at Coimbatore, attended Devi seva for 21 days, and knows many aspects of the ashram like food, clothing, seva and stay area. He has stayed in Adiyogi Alayam during Devi seva, lived in hostel for 5 years before, so he is comfortable with shared stay during the program.

Anna worked as an accountant for five years in Dubai from 2017 to 2023. He had to close the debt from his father's cancer treatment. He returned back to India after closing the debt and started working on his ancestral farm to continue his legacy since his mom alone was not able to manage it and also to be with nature.

He has a hobby of playing badminton for three hours everyday for physical activity.

Anna finished this B.Com degree in 2013, studied chartered accountant from 2013 to 2020. He is planning to give the CA final exam after sadhanapada, not for a career but just to finish the degree in the last step. He wants to parallelly manage his farm too while studying for CA.

Anna is fluent in Kannada, Tulu, English, Hindi. He can also understand Tamil and Telugu.

Father passed away in 2013 with NHL cancer. Younger sister is working on CA finals and also working as a lecturer. Mother used to manage the farm by herself before but she had a surgery to get the Uterus removed and now cannot do physical work but she guides anna and labours to work on the farm.

Applicant sister has already attended Sadhanapada and been an inspiration for him to take on this program. His mother has no problem of him attending the program and there is no dependency on him either in any way. Consent call can be done to mother to confirm.

Anna had a huge debt of his father's cancer treatment when he passed away so he had to go to Dubai to earn money and closed the debt in 2022 completely.

Anna said he has more than enough amount of money for him to sustain the whole seven months earned on farming. His house hold members are not dependent on him especially when they have enough labours for the farm.
None

Anna has finished Isha programs: Shambhavi Mahamudra, Yogasanas, Surya Kriya, BSP, Bhairavi program, guru puja, Angamardana, Shivanga Sadhana. He is waiting to do Samyama in 2026 by preparing himself through Sadhanapada 2025. 

On daily basis he is doing Shambhavi mahamudra, Shoonya, SCK, Yogasanas and guru pooja. He also has a non-Isha practice called Rama Tanki which is a ritual he performs at home. His family can replace him for the practice when he is in Sadhanapada. 

Anna remembers all the Shambhavi steps correctly and it takes him 40 mins to finish preparatory asanas ad shambhavi.

He volunteered at IYC Coimbatore for Devi seva. He also has been volunteering locally in his village temple since childhood like decoration during festivals, serving to devotees etc.

Anna was very enthusiastic during the call and transparent about everything. He was smiling constantly and very content about the farming legacy he has been carrying forward.

Anna said he is content without marriage at this point in life, so he is not thinking about it.

Anna will have to step out of the ashram for 3 days in August next year to perform his father's death ceremony at home.
His family takes a Crop loan of 3 lakhs with 0 percent interest because he can claim it as farmer's benefit but don't really need the loan. They repay the loan every end of year.

Since 1 year, his schedule is: 7.30am wake up, Sadhana till 10.30am, breakfast at 1040am, starts working on farm from 11am to 2pm, 3pm lunch, 4pm-5.30pm farm, tea/coffee snack, 7pm-10pm badminton, sleep at 10.30pm. Sometimes, he has heavy dinner and sleep after 12am.

Since 10 days he changed his schedule. 4.30am wake up, guru pooja, 3 Bhairavi stutis till 8am, play for 2 hours, 8to10am practices, 10.15am breakfast, CA final study and the rest of the schedule is same.

Anna drinks tea twice every day.

column54: At this point in my life, I feel there is a part of me that remains unfulfilled. While I may be working hard, I sense that I am not operating at my full potential, or perhaps I am, but I am still not satisfied with where I am. I wish to fully own and enhance this potential, focusing my attention and energy to reach my true capabilities. I believe the Sadhanapada program will provide me with the tools and environment needed to explore this part of myself, helping me grow into a more focused and empowered version of myself.
column55: I believe that following a strict daily schedule, having limited personal time, and adhering to the program’s expectations and ashram guidelines are essential for my inner growth. I have always wanted to adopt a structured routine, waking up early and engaging in purposeful activities. Although this schedule is more demanding than my current one, it aligns with the direction I want to take in my life. I understand it won’t be easy, but I am ready to embrace it with an open mind and a willingness to grow. I see this as an opportunity to strengthen my discipline and focus, knowing it will lead to something meaningful.
column56: I believe the physical demands of the program, such as walking long distances, sitting cross-legged, and engaging in challenging activities like farming, are ultimately for our own physical well-being. I actually enjoy physical work, and sitting cross-legged feels natural to me, as it’s something I’ve done since childhood. While farming may be new to me, I am excited about the opportunity to learn. I’ve always had a small hobby of gardening at home, which has helped me feel connected to nature, so I don’t foresee this being an issue. In fact, I think it will be a rewarding experience.
column57: The webinar has made it clear that it's not about seeking comfort but about fostering inner growth. With that in mind, I am fully willing to be assigned to any kind of volunteering activity, whether it is physically demanding or office-based, for the entire duration of the program. I understand that each task has its purpose, and I don’t want to be selective or seek comfort in what I do. My focus is on fully immersing myself in seva and embracing the experience, knowing that this is key to my personal growth.
column58: Sharing space with many other volunteers, such as in a dormitory or shared bathroom facilities, is a bit outside my comfort zone, as I’m used to having more personal space. However, I see this as an opportunity for growth. It’s something I’d like to work on, as learning to live and collaborate with others in close quarters will be valuable for me, not only during the program but also in life. I believe this experience will help me become more adaptable and open, which is a crucial part of the journey.
column59: My family is supportive of my decision to stay at the Isha Yoga Center for the full seven-month duration of the program. While they may not fully understand all the aspects of the program, they trust my decisions and believe that it is for my own good. They have always supported my personal growth and are not going to stand in the way of this important journey in my life. Their trust and support give me confidence in committing to this experience wholeheartedly.
column60: What types of sadhanas are practiced during the seven-month program, and how do they help in reaching deeper levels of inner growth and transformation? I am looking forward to being able to live at the Ashram Space, with people who are seeking the same purpose of growing and breaking limitations. In this context, after watching the video, and the people who were doing Sadhanapadana when I was at the ashram last month, I am excited to grow in many ways: physically, improving my flexibility, stamina, regeneration, endurance and strength; mentally, becoming sharper, and clearer in my mind, with more equanimity; Emotionally, having more intensity, fluidity and conscious of them; and Energetically, improving my energy levels, and consciously start knowing them more closely. 
Also, developing more awareness, perception of life, and being able to connect more profoundly with the oneness that intellectually I can understand the universe is. 
I am striving to break my limitations, I see clearly that I don't want to live with them anymore, and it is okay if they are here for some more time now, but not much time, want to be free of them as soon as possible.

But I didn't give Sadhana focus full - 100% time. I find that it is unfair that the most important aspect of my life hasn't received a fully focused attention. This is why I wish to plunge into Sadhanapada and allow myself to neither be distracted nor strive for anything else. I just want to give the "inner" absolute attention and focus. I am ceratain that there will be no better place or time to do that than at the Ashram and to do it as soon as possible. I have been to the Ashram 4 times. column54: For as long as I can remember, I have always been looking for an authentic process for personal exploration and transformation, and when I came across Sadhanapada back in 2022, I immediately knew that this is it. By participating in the program, I want to commit myself and stay at the ashram for at least 7 continuous months to fully immerse myself into the yogic practices Sadhguru offered and see the profound impacts theses practices bring. In the end, I hope to explore deeper on the nature this life. In addition, I aspire to become a better version of myself after these 7 months, where hopefully I will be a more balanced, stable and joyful human being with more compassion and clarity in life. I just have a deep longing for self exploration and transformation and I just know that there is nothing in the world right now that is potent and powerful as Sadhanapada. And for the past 2 years, Sadhanapada has always been in the back of my mind.

column54:
I have recently been initiated into Shambhavi Mahamudra, and the practice has had a profound impact on both my mental and physical well-being. This transformative experience has made me realize that now is the perfect moment to immerse myself deeper into the yogic path through the Sadhanapada program. 
 
Additionally, I am currently at a phase in my life where there are no external pressures, such as marriage, allowing me the freedom to focus entirely on my inner growth. As I approach 30, I want to participate in this program while I am in good health, so I can fully embrace the physical, mental, and spiritual demands it entails. After Sadhanapada, I also plan to pursue higher education, potentially a PhD, and I believe this experience will provide a strong foundation for that journey. 
 
Above all, attending Sadhanapada in the presence of Sadhguru is a deeply personal aspiration. His guidance has been pivotal in my life, and I feel a deep calling to be in his presence during this transformative phase.

column54: I have been wanting to do Sadhanapada for the last 3 years and was supposed to join the 2022 batch. But there were personal commitments I had to settle and hence I had made a decision to take up an assignment that had come to me at the same time and complete it. I have finished settling my personal requirements and also completing the task I had undertaken by April 2025. Hence, I feel from within that it is time for me to experience Sadhanapada. I hope to focus and discover new things about myself during the program.  I have been through intense experiences with Sadhguru in the advanced programs that I have attended. I have heard what he has said about Sadhanapada. I therefore want to do the program now as Iam in the best of my health and spirit. I wish to  become a better person and something within me says that I may be able to expand my vision of the world around me, enhance my capability, discover new areas of my strengths, and evolve much  more than I can ever imagine . I trust this journey which I want to experience in my life will help me to discover my true self and nature. Hence, I want to invest this time when my Guru is around. I have worked more than 20 years in varied sectors like defence, Airports, corporates but there is something more I am searching for, trying to find my true self.  I wish to be in the consecrated space of Isha and go through this program which I know is intense. I wish to discover myself in the process.It will also give me an opportunity to contribute towards the SaveSoil movement. Although I have been in Aviation for more than 20 years, I had done my graduation and a year of masters in Agricultural marketing and cooperation. I love nature, working with farmers and connecting to the amazing projects of Isha. I hope to contribute to Sadhguru's vision. I think this course will help me spread my horizon to real issues, give me an opportunity to touch lives  and discover things that I could never imagine I would do.

He went to gym to build his muscles, the owner of the gym trained him and gave partnership with no investment from his side, but he gets 50% share in profit. He's working from past 8-9years. He feels something is lacking so he's into sadhana now finding stability.

Saved money for both Mother and himself for the program. He's moving his mother near his sister's house by renting a small house.

His mother passed away in 2015 due to Brain Hemorrhage. She was actually diagnosed with Malaria first & due to overdose of medicine it led to Brain Hemorrhage. It was a difficult time for him but Yoga somehow helped him to come out of this. He also completed PG Diploma in Yoga & meditation . Has a certificate but doesnt practice it. In the past he has taught it to few people. He also mention when he was in school he had joined this "Bharatiya Yoga Sanstha" & practiced their yoga for 6 months then. IE completed in Jan 2024 through online mode. He feels IE is like a daily capsule for him. It has made him calmer & feels physically fit. Able to handle situations in a better way as he has  targets too in his bank. Thereafter he learnt Surya kriya & Angamardana in Ahmadabad early this year from Isha Hatha Yoga teacher(Taradeep). These 2 practices have made his body flexible & also he feels physical fit. In the past he used to sleep for 7-8 hours & now he sleeps only for 5-6 hrs  but his energy levels are  really high throughout the day. As of now he is only practicing Isha Yoga & is also aware about not following/Practicing two different schools of Yoga. Languages known to him are English & Hindi. He is fluent in both. 

Hobbies: He is very fond of Cricket & Football. Loves to travel.
During his School days he was an NCC Cadet.

He had previously applied for SP 2024 & was selected also. But his brother asked him to continue working so that atleast 3 years of work experience he should have  so that even if he goes for SP program when he is back it should not be an issue for his profession. That was the only reason he is continuing with his current job. For the next year his brother is fine with him coming for the program. In the emergency details brother's contact is given. Brother is in UK. I have collected his fathers contact details also. Father contact:6260570197(Preferred language is Hindi)
Has Educational loan which will be cleared before Sadhanapada program starts.

Active Lifestyle: Wakes up at 5.30/6am. Does Hatha yoga(Surya kriya & Angamardhana ) followed by Shambhavi. Heads to Bank from 9.00am to 7pm. Then he attends his Data Science class untill 9.00pm post which he has Dinner & goes to bed at 10.30pm. Food that he consumes is mostly more of  raw food(Salads,fruits).Doesn't drink Tea/Coffee, Alcohol, No smoking & also no Drugs. Weekends he likes to play Football/Cricket.

column36: Immediately after he completed his BSP in July 2024 he came for BSP Volunteering which had Sadhanapada 2024 participants in that batch. column54: I completed Inner Engineering Online on 7th July,24. Sadhguru said, if you are with me for one moment completely, we don't need this laptop, phone ,video , etc. I can initiate you just like that if you are ready. And I had tears flowing down my eyes continuously. I couldn't understand the emotion. I wasn't happy or sad but it was an explosion inside of me. Immediately, I requested Isha Yoga Center Coimbatore to allow me to take part in Bhava Spandana the following week on July 16th and by his grace, they did allow me, after which I immediately signed up for volunteering for BSP. Co incidentally, this was BSP for 2024 Sadhana Pada participants. I was so inspired by their energy levels. Volunteering opened up something new inside me as I had never volunteered/helped around anywhere before. Sadhguru has always surprised me and taken me for a ride and I just sit with him. I don't know how I am hoping to grow. I am someone who just jumps into things without any expectations.  I just want to do more and more sadhana and seva and dissolve into everything.
column55: I think its the perfect schedule. In my experience of being an Ashram Program Volunteer in the past, I thoroughly enjoyed it. Not using my phone so much and reducing my words to 50% became so easy to practice, with the schedule given to me. It made me realize how much (for the lack of a better word) garbage was in my mind and activity everyday and how I was doing so many things compulsively. It made me a more conscious person.
column56: I am quite physically active and make sure I walk or run at least 2-3 kms a day. I have also started practicing Yogasanas, therefore, I'll be okay with everything.
column57: When I enrolled myself for BSP Volunteering, I definitely had some resistance towards some activities. We were taught a mantra and when I would recite it, doing anything and everything became so easy and blissful. Therefore, I am okay with any activity assigned to me.
column58: I studied in a Boarding School and there, it was a huge dorm of 60 people. I have already lived in spaces like that and I grew up to miss it. So, Im quite excited to be taken back to my school days!

column36: He makes his living by playing Poker professionally. He has no job or as such so he can come for the program . On asking how will he manage while he is here for SP for which he said that he will not be taking up Poker for the entire duration of the program.

Has no issues with Stay as he has prior experience of staying in dorms & has also stayed in Adiyogi Alayam during volunteering. Food, Clothing & Seva is also not a concern for him & is manageable by him.

There have been multiple job switches over the years. He worked for a year in BPO where he was handling technical customer issues in the front end.  Then he worked for Tech Mahindra for 4 months as Sales Advisor & then quit. He again worked at various places didnt mention the name of the organizations. He felt that its all waste of time. Now since 2 years he has been playing Poker professionally both Online as well as Offline. Through Poker he is making his living.

He was very Good in Academics untill his 11th after which in 12th he  dropped out. He joined Engineering (IT) then quit. Then joined MBA again quit. Due to societal pressure he somehow managed to complete BA in Psychology in 2021.

Father is working in Bangalore as GM in TATA & his mom is a lawyer but currently not practicing. Sister has recently graduated in Clinical Psychology. His Father & Mother watch Sadhgurus video but have not learnt  any Isha practices. Sister has completed IE. Family is very supportive of him participating in Sadhanapada .
He said he has enough savings to take care of his expenses during Sadhanapada & nor is anybody else dependent on him.
NA

He has volunteered for BSP in July 2024. During Janamashtami he volunteered with the Aesthetics team & also has experience of volunteering  in Biksha Hall & Akshaya. Never volunteered anywhere outside Isha.

He was very much involved during the call. He looked very Enthusisastic. At certain places I noticed he was scratching his head.He has always been travelling around  be it for Education or due to Poker he traveled to Vietnam, Goa . Until 11th he was very good in Academics but after that he kept on jumping from one field to the other. He thought it was waste of time. Its not serving the purpose. The journey that he has gone through from his college it felt that he was unstable. He used to not write exams & would leave the paper blank because he felt that this piece of paper will not define him. Due to societal & family pressure he finally completed BA in Psychology from Pune. He then started playing Poker & till date he continues playing it. Poker is the source of income for him currently. He saw Sadhgurus video about IE & thought why not register for it & see what it does to him. In  July 2024 he completed his IE. His experience was something beyond words & tears could not stop flowing out of his eyes. IE has made him much calmer ,able to sleep better & also his stamina has increased. He then immediately applied for BSP in the same month & completed it & then immediately applied for BSP volunteering . During BSP Volunteering he saw all Sadhanapada participants energy levels & got inspired. During the same time he saw people in Ashram doing Kaka Kriya so he didnt want to miss  on it & immediately completed Shoonya Intensive. He has completed his Shambhavi Mandala. Only one evening he missed his Shambhavi practice till date. Learnt Yogasanas post Shoonya & has been practicing the same. He wants to come in this space & deepen his Sadhana & do as much as he can for this organization. Currently he is in Mumbai but has been travelling a lot around. Currently he along with his mom & sister staying in Mumbai. Father is working in Bangalore he got transferred there. He will be getting retired in a couple of years. Parents are very supportive of his participation in SP. Sister has completed IE & then learnt Yogasanas as well. He has given sisters contact details as emergency contact . Took his parents contact number. Father:9920713699
Mother:9769420235. Preferred language is English for the parents. The applicant is fluent in English & Hindi. Dad has BP & some issues with Back.
He has been visiting a counselor since school days & continued uptil 2016. His parents found him weird because he used to not write anything in his exams would leave the paper blank. There was no any medication given during the counselling sessions. It was just a conversation. Nothing Major. Loves to play football on weekends. Loves to travel around. Overall he looked really Stable during the call.
NA

He wakes up around 6am or 7am & does his Practices(Yogasanas,SCK,Shambhavi & Shoonya). He then has his breakfast & spends time in poker from 11am to 4pm. At 4pm he goes to gym for workout. Post 7pm he again spends time in playing Poker for 2-3 hrs. He goes to bed by 11pm/12pm.
He consumes Alcohol on occasional basis. Doesn't have the habit of drinking Tea/Coffee as he doesn't feel good. He was addicted to smoking right from 15yrs of age & in April 2024 he completely quit it. It took him some time to come out of his smoking habit. Since April 2024 is has not smoked & also doesn't have the urge for it.

column54:
I want to do sadanapada for the following reasons 
 
1. Develop clarity : After attending Samyama in December 2022, my life completely turned upside down. The experience has been too intense and mystical to even articulate. The old structure within me just crumbled. Nothing of mine remained. I became alien to myself. For the first time in my life, I didn't know what to do with my life except for the intense longing to rediscover my purpose and hasten my spiritual growth. Now I want to give my time and effort to develop  clarity and direction within myself.  
 
2. Intensify sadana :  Outside ashram, it is quite difficult to practice all sadanas regularly due to time restrictions,  lack of committed atmosphere, schedule and support. In ashram, one can immerse fully  in intense sadana because of highly energetic consecrated space, well structured schedule and support. I did intense sadana for a month during my samyama preparation and I saw immense change in terms of physical, mental, emotional and energetic aspects. If practicing intensely just for a month can give such great results, I wonder how drastic, immense and life changing, it can be if one practices intensely for 7 months!  
 
3. Consecrated space : Consecrated space can ignite one's energy system into different dimension and ultimate possibility. It helps one to lead concentrated and highly vibrant life.  
 
4. Strong foundation :  I want to first build stable platform interms of body, mind, emotions and energy to explore the ultimate spiritual possibility. I want to develop unwavering focus, discipline and dedication. I want to be able to handle both big and small tasks or challenges without getting overwhelmed or stressed out.  
 
5. Spiritual growth : I have been an intense seeker of truth from a very young age. I have had many profound questions about the universe, life and the nature of reality. I have found answers to few of my questions after coming in contact with Sadhguru but many are still unanswered. I am rigorously and consistently searching answers through the yogic science. I want to know the very source of my life and the creation at any cost. I want to mature spiritually as fast as possible and explode into the ultimate possibility of being a human.  
 
6. Joy of volunteering :  volunteering is a wonderful opportunity to offer oneself through action. Its a powerful process, where one can loosen up rigid personality structures, to become absolute willing and open to life. I want to grow beyond my limited likes and dislikes, ideas and opinions and become willing, flexible and open through selfless involvement. I want to be able to treat every action, whether it's small or big, with equal involvement and devotion. There is immense joy and satisfaction in volunteering. 
 
7. Poornanaga and bramhacharya : After samyama, I don't seem to find satisfaction and fulfillment in any of the activities concerning the outside world. A sense of incompleteness is growing within me as I try to involve more and more with the outside world. On the contrary, there is a deep sense of satisfaction and fulfillment in offering oneself as volunteer at ashram. In this two years period, I have developed a strong desire or inclination towards becoming full time volunteer and eventually may be brahmacharya. So I want to use sadanapada as a testing ground to see if it is the right thing for me.

I have been following Isha and Guru for 5 years, and Guru has completely changed my life, allowing me to find the ultimate purpose of my life. Guru has provided us with a comprehensive system to support us towards the ultimate goal. I have clearly defined my ultimate goal and am determined to continue moving forward.  
In order to reach the ultimate as soon as possible, following Guru and growing in the consecrated space of Guru is bound to be the fastest. In this process, the Seva accelerated my transformation and inner growth, and I can clearly feel the different stages of my growth. Meanwhile, I want to make something happen in the world with guru and isha. Then I wish to go through Sadhanapada. column54:
My life is about breaking limitations and becoming more life. To be more joyful, vital and inclusive. 
I'm already progressing in that way and wish to get the extra support from the Sadhanapada program. 
I feel that it's the right time because I have built myself mentally during the last few years to be able and willing to go through such intensity that the program demands. I am staying in the IYC for a long time and life here suits me. 
I want to get to a place in my life where my experience is conscious and independent. I find life outside the Ashram more scattered and less supportive so I feel like I need some more time here to transform myself to a level where even if I'm outside and of the Ashram and I will choose the traditional course of university or work, it won't come as a compromise on my mental health and spiritual growth.

She realized that without consciousness if she can gain so much benefit what if i do with consciously. After that she kept practicing consciously and wants to come stay here for 8months to intensify her sadhana.
column54: In my early twenties, I had planned to attend Sadhanapada, but life had other ideas. I got sidetracked by the trivialities of daily life, and entangled in matters that were neither necessary nor meaningful. If someone asked me to pinpoint a specific reason for this detour, my honest answer would be, 'I don't know.' I feel a deep need to participate in this program now, as I believe it will help me gain a greater understanding of life. At this moment, I feel burdened by my own existence and I don’t want to be a burden to my own life. I want to transition from merely being alive and conscious to being consciously alive. This program feels like a crucial step toward that transformation.

column36: Akka is doing freelancing now. She said she will not take any projects if she comes here

She has stayed in hostel for three years during her under graduation. She said she used to share her room with three people. Even when she came here for MSR volunteering she used to stay in dorm. So she was ok with sharing her space during this 8months. No hesitation was observed.

She was working with DGR constructions for an year as assistant accountant. Her role was to file monthly Vat and GST. She has a break for one year from 2017-18 as she was preparing for her exams. Again from 2018-2022 she was working with Rajashankar Tax consultancy. After 2022 she is been doing freelancing. She works on GST and IT filing. She can ready, write and talk Tamil, English. Can understand Hindi
She has completed B.Com. She was supposed to be graduated in 2016 but she has typhoid and was not able to complete it. So she graduated in 2017.

Both her parents are isha meditators and they are aware that she has applied for sadhanapada and they are ok with it. Have informed that team will be calling for parental consent. She was ok with it. Can call for parental consent after Nov 6th as they are travelling right now. Prefers tamil speaking Vol
Since she is been working for quite sometime she has sufficient saving to manage during that 7months.

She was been married to two years now and it was a arranged marriage. She said they were not getting along well. Her husband is doing business and doesn't spend time with family and not a family oriented guy. They don't have kids Since it was disturbing both of them and their family they mutually decided to get separated. Their divorce is going on right now and akka mentioned by April 2025 the legal proceedings with be over. No physical presence will be involved after that.  She was emotionally stable when we spoke about this and she didn't have any hesitation to share these details when asked.
She has done Program Volunteering (BSP) and MSR volunteering for three years. Apart from that she is also supporting local center now with Gramotsavam.
She joined call on time. She presented herself well and was confident. Seemed like she was more aware about the schedule and other aspects of ashram like dress code and food.
Her father took home loan on her name but it will closed in next two months. Before she comes here that will be closed.

Sedentary life style.  Akka wakes up by 7.00am prepares breakfast for her parents and then does her practice. She does smk regularly, SK- 2/7 and angamardhana 4/7. After her practice she has her brunch and sits for work. She is a freelancer doing GST and IT filling now. Work will get over by 6 and after that she has dinner and spends time with family and does household work. She sleeps by 10.30pm. No habit of drinking  Milk/Tea/ coffee/alcohol/cigarette/ drugs.

column36:
✔ She has well-paid job, apartment, nice life, all comfort and convenience, but is looking for profoundness as she has the urge to do something deeper with her life ever since she started her journey with Isha. She is looking at SP as tool for breaking her limitations and resistance towards unpleasant or uncomfortable life situations and deepen her already ongoing practice and spiritual path. 
✔She knows people who went through the program, and she saw their transformation and glow after programs. She wants the same. She didn’t apply sooner as she felt insecure about money/apartment/job to come to India for a long time. But now, she feels it is the right time, and she is fully ready, and she went through all other programs as preparation and is 100% sure she could make this commitment to come to SP
✔ IE – finished 2021 online. Sadhguru deeply touches her, and since she started doing practice (as soon as it was available), she feels like she started to live life and that that was the best decision of her life. She is more comfortable in difficult situations, has more joy and energy during the day, is more balanced, and can focus more on solutions instead of anger. 
✔ Did all Isha programs; only Samyama left, and she is doing practices every day.
column54: I have a well paid job, a nice apartment, good relationships with friends and family. Everything that is considered a "good life". But there is something very much missing which I would call as profoundness, for lack of better words. Although, I have all this comfort and convenience, the urge to do something really worthwile and existentially valuable with my life is burning within me for few years now. I noticed that all this comfort and "security" is making me dull and creates more and more limitations/boundaries and resistance towards new things/changes in my life. For example, the thought of loosing my job causes so much anxiety and stress within me, as if there would not be any other possibilties in my life than this particular job. I realized, that I am really loosing my flexibility and agility to mold myself in different "shapes" as situations change. And this emptiness which all this causes in me reached a point where I clearly see/feel that it is not acceptable anymore. I am burning to explore the nature of me as a human being in its fullest depth and dimentsion and shift my focus completely inward. I am definitely determined to gain my flexibility and freedom back, which I had as a child. I don't want to live on the surface anymore and only experience deeper dimensions when I am volunteering or doing any activity with Isha. I want this profoundness and joy in my daily life. I think using Sadhanapada as tool for breaking my limitations and resistance towards unpleasant or uncomfortable life situations would make the change that I want to create.The structure that is given in the program would definitely be a huge support to keep up the motivation, enthusiasm and energy to keep going. Also having fixed times for guided Sadhana together with all participants gives a great boost to stick to the commitment to take up and of course complete the program. I'm striving to live a fullfilled, profound life which is worthwhile for myself and others around me. I am willing to commit and give myself to the process of the program and make use of everything which is given by Sadhguru and the energized space in the Ashram. I am willing to confront/overcome my gratest fears of insecurity and uncomfort of giving up my life as I know it till now and fully be present in the program for the whole duration whatever it takes. Never before in my life I felt so cristal clear that now is the time to invest in my inner growth and to do whatever is needed for it. I have the vision that I take up this path and stay for long term volunteering and become a Pournanga in the Ashram. Sadhanapada program is my first step towards this larger "goal" of mine.
column55: It will challenge me a lot to stay open and accept all situations that are occuring and overcoming the resistance withing me. But also I know that if I'm willing to grow I can handle everything with joy and go through the program without struggle.  Since I am also a very structured person and following a kind of schedule in my daily life, I can apapt to the strict daily schedule and fixed times for different activities. I'm familiar with the guidelines of staying in the Ashram as I have been there already, so this is not a problem.
column56: I am practicing Isha Yoga daily since more than 3 years now and also practice sitting in Ardhasiddasana while eating or watching TV at home, I think I am physically not bad prepared at least. Furthermore I am danicing Salsa and Batchata 4x/week for 2-4h/day which is also very intensly training the whole body. There will definitely be challenging times where my body would feel week or sth. but overall I'm quite confident that I can manage.
column57: I trust the structure of the program designed by Sadhguru and will take up whatever activity will be given to me.

column36: She has been working in the finance department of a big company for 6 years. And she is planning to ask for unpaid leave. She is unsure if the company will agree, and they are unaware of her interest in yoga.

✔ She was in the Ashram for two weeks in April last year, and she did the Shoonya program here. Her stay was a roller coaster. She felt high energy like can do many things in a day, and she was waking up easily, but also many things came up about past experiences, childhood, and breakups with friends; she started to question everything in her life: her job, how she wanted to live the rest of my life. That motivated her even more to seek fulfilment. 


✔ She has an excellent understanding of the program. Understand that focus shall be on herself and that she shouldn't seek company and strive to make friends. She is aware this is best tool for her to learn to be balanced and overcome limitations. 
✔ Schedule - She is a very structured person and is already following a strict daily schedule, so she doesn’t think she will have a problem with that. Also is familiar with the guidelines of staying in the Ashram. Mentioned that sometimes she struggles to get up in the morning early to do practices but she always does them. 
✔ Food – Loves food here. Usually follows a vegan diet but eats honey and ghee. She has problems digesting milk, but nothing serious. She already eats twice a day. 
✔ Seva - avoids having likes and dislikes and is willing to do any seva. 
✔ Stay – thinks it will be her greatest challenge, especially the lack of privacy and sharing rooms. She loves to have a quiet place where to be alone. She thinks she will be able to cope as she will barely have free time, and when it becomes hard, she will apply IE rules.

✔ Now has been working in the financial department of a big company for the last 6 years. Previously did various jobs: cleaning bakery, call centre work (8 hours a day with no break), apprenticeship in a retail shop
Accounting

✔Only mother who is also Isha meditator and went through IE. She is very supportive and would be, although she mentioned that the mother might miss her a lot. But, they are not living in the same city anyway. They see each other once a month, but they talk on the phone daily. They are both willing to adjust.

also to rent her apartment while in India.

She is the perfect person to come to this program! She does a lot of sadhana, is fully engaged in volunteering, and has been in an Ashram. She seems as a very stable and balanced person. Has a responsible job and well-structured life doing lots of activities and hobbies. Only red flag: previous depression

column54:
I applied for Sadhanapada in 2022 and was accepted, however I had trouble organising a passport and visa in time, as wait times were crazy during COVID in Australia, and ended up missing out. I didn't apply the following 2 years as I had a business at home and a girlfriend and got caught up with those things a little bit. However this time, I have closed the business and have no partners and so feel I can 100% be at the ashram without home on my mind. 
I am at the ashram currently and it has been nice to fully focus on being here, being here 100%. So I think this is a good time for me to do Sadhanapada when Sadhanapada will be the only thing in my life. So I'm hoping to go through the program with 100% involvement and participation
column55: It will be nice to commit myself to the schedule, having little personal time and no days off I feel will just help you dissolve even more in the program. column36:
Anna has learnt Shambhavi, SCK, Bhuta Shuddhi, Angamardana, Yogasanas in the past but never practiced them or completed a mandala coz he never understood the impact they are going to have. However, he restarted his Shambhavi after attending a Satsang in 2020 and talking to an Ishanga. However, he never restarted the hatha and other practices due to his schedule for which he wants to come to Sadhanapada and spend dedicated time to re-learn and be consistent with them.

He has had some experience with Shambhavi where he was crying 6am to 8am following day after restarting his Shambhavi practice with and love and inclusiveness with everything. One other experience he had was during FMF during the night out of the same inclusiveness. So, he wanted to explore more in depth during the Sadhanapada program and is also looking for transformation that come with it.

column54:
I will be completing my postgraduation in february 2025 and can dedicate completely for the program. I will be a bachelor without any financial burden and my family members are not financially dependent on me.   
This opportunity might not be there later on as i think i might get caught up with social and personal things. 
 
In terms of growth, 
i would like to become strong, agile and increase my stamina physically and would like be able to go and come down velliangiri hill without going out of breath like the local people there. 
 
Mentally i would like to have a stable mental balance in all situations so that everyday its not a turmoil to go through life. 
i have always struggled to maintain an inclusive emotion while i work. i would like to change that, so that i can keep my emotions always pleasant irrespective of the situation i am placed in.  
 
Spiritually or energywise i would like to just reach my fullest potential . Not growth, i would like to transform and mutate while i am in Sadhanapada .  
 
Lastly i would like to complete Samyama with sadhguru while i am in Sadhanapada.
column55:
no personal time, no off days are a part of my life since 3 years as i am pursuing my postgraduate studies, and i am comfortable with it. 
Strict daily schedule is also a part of my postgraduate life since 3 years. Waking up at 4 30 am might be challenging but its not something that i cannot do. 
I am willing to follow the given instructions as i understand that they are there to make me grow and to keep me focused on my spiritual growth.

i have been accustomed to walking up and down the floors of the hospital and also standing and working in operation theaters for long hours. In the ashram walking is a lot more which i can manage.

Farming will be new experience for me and i am fully looking forward for it, if such a seva is allotted to me.

column54:
Namaskaram, I was initiated to shambhavi in 2017, and have seen immense benefits in all aspects of my life due to it. However, whenever the work stress increased, my sadhana continuity broke, also under extreme work conditions external factors again started affecting me, these cycles have happened a few times now, in past 5 years. I want to learn to keep doing my sadhana with utmost intensity even in a very busy schedule and want to be as balanced as possible under any kind of external situation.  
 
I have been in phases where the sadhana is happening beautifully and I am in complete balance, but the growth has been slow, as whenever work pressure increased, I was not able to maintain my sadhana intensity. Last MSR 2024 volunteering in security team was an eye opener, during the volunteering I was able to perform my activities, which were very challenging and new for me effortlessly, without any impact on me, the balance I felt for a few months after the MSR volunteering was what I have been looking for.
column55:
For the sadhana to intensify and for me to gain a transformative sense of balance and clarity, i think the strict daily schedule is needed, and I am confident I will be able to follow it. 
 
Since all aspects of the program schedule are designed for personal growth, it is worth sacrificing the personal time. Anyways the most important aspects of my current usage of the personal time is already covered in the schedule, like sadhana, food and seva. Minimising mobile usage is something I would love to make a habit. If possible not using it at all for entertainment. Only using it if any activity is to be performed. 
 
In my current schedule, I have office work mostly morning 9 am to evening 9 pm and weekends I do local center Volunteering activities, so no days off is perfectly fine, since it's for volunteering, whatever be the activity. 
 
Staying in the ashram for 7 to 8 months will not be a concern, My parents are independent and i am single, so there is no urgent dependencies, i have been planning for financial backup for this for last 3 years, so now I am ready with that as well.
column56:
I enjoyed the barefoot walks I did all day during the 10 days of my volunteering for 2024 MSR volunteering. Since it was in security team, we had to go for long walks for rece of the points. Only crossing the metal bridge during the afternoon sun was a challenge, rest all made me feel more fit and energetic. 
 
Even as a participant for grace of yoga in 2022 MSR, even though shuttle service was provided, i preferred and enjoyed walking barefoot to the halls. 
 
I am used to going for long treks with local Isha Meditator friends, once in 3-4 weeks. These are on an average 5 to 8 km treks.  
 
Over the years I have been able to sit more time comfortably cross legged, as of now I am able to sit around 1 hr to 1.5 hrs comfortably cross legged, I want to improve this. 
 
Since I get to work from home, during farming season many times I stay in Mangalore my hometown and volunteer wherever possible with farming activities at my familial farms. After volunteering for save soil to conduct sessions for students, I have also myself become more aware of the deep relationship between soil health and plant health, and i practice the learnings of this daily in my small but beautiful balcony gardens, would love to show some pictures of the produce. I also manage a composting setup of 30 liters in my balcony to process daily kitchen waste, this has been running successfully for last 3 years. Also have been teaching it to Isha meditator friends, some have replicated it at their home.
column57: I am completely willing to be assigned to any activity that needs my service for the full duration of the program.
column58: I am perfectly ok with sharing space with others. This will be a good test of my sadhana. I did not find this a concern at all during my 10 days of MSR volunteering and BSP participation as well.

column36: Anna is working as an associate lawyer intern and a financial analyst or stock trader on the side. These are the professions he can work and quit whenever he wants according to him. From the webinar, He is looking forward to experience the lifestyle of the ashram. His current challenge is to sit in ardha-siddhasana for longer times. He is able to sit for 30 to 40 minutes without any issues but cannot sit more than that.

He started as an associate lawyer in Supreme Court of India under a senior lawyer and then move to work for a company for some time and then move back to Supreme Court of India under a different senior lawyer this time . She was interning basically in different roles . She took a break of one or two months in between after his graduation till now . 

Apart from LLB, Anna has a diploma in corporate governance and finance which is based on capital market and stock trades. So he also trades stocks on the side parallelly being a lawyer. 

Anna has also done a three month course on Digital marketing and also as a diploma on national Stock Exchange related to capital market.

Anna's hobbies include going on Trek whenever possible. He has visited Himalayas, Vaishno Devi temple twice, Kedarnath, surpass trek in Himachal Pradesh.

Anna has done Bachelor of Law from Pune University and graduated in 2020. He has interned under a senior lawyer, worked for a company and again moved to work under a different senior lawyer this time maintaining his continuous work experience after his graduation.

His father approves his involvement with Isha and him going to Sadhanapada. Father also has been a lawyer and he is self-sufficient and is not dependent on the applicant. column54:
I completed Hatha Yoga teacher training in 2023. At the end of 2023, I set out to try teaching Isha Hatha Yoga in Germany. However, I quickly realized that while I am someone who practice, I don’t feel the need to talk about it or encourage others to follow the same path. Additionally, I encountered resistance in the very rational German society toward what I was doing. So, teaching soon lost its purpose for me. After my return from India, not only did teaching fail to work out, but all the other activities I tried to establish to make a living independently also did not succeed. 
 
After months of struggle, I applied for my old job—a job I had promised myself never to return to before starting Hatha Yoga teacher training. That was about three months ago. For me, doors in Germany remained closed, which made me recall what Sadhguru had said when he came to the Hatha Yoga school during training. He said that if teaching didn’t work out, one should come back to the ashram. For some reason, those words stayed in my mind the whole time. 
 
When it became clear to me that returning to the ashram was my only path, I spoke with Lokendra Anna from the Hatha Yoga school and sought his advice on the best way to return as a long-term volunteer. After listening to me, he said the best option would be to do Sadhanapada. So I applied shortly after.

This experience had given me a glimpse of what to expect in a program like Sadhanapada. I am hoping that there will be a lot of limitations within myself that will come up during the program so that I can clearly see where I need to work on myself. I also hope that by doing the practices daily, being in a consecrated environment and having the support of people walking the same path that I can develop the clarity that I need to be able to overcome my limitations.
